page.title: 06TOURISM IN FYLINGDALES
page.content: 2% said they would not, obviously they did not like it in Robin Hoods Bay. 28% of our visitors came by car. Some cycled here. A similar number came by bus or train, while 2% walked here. Our visitors stayed at a variety of places. 15 people had caravans. Fewer stayed in tents. 7 stayed in hotels. 5 people were day visitors and 3 people were staying for bed and breakfast. 30% stayed longer than a day. 40% were staying longer than a week while 22% were day visitors. We wanted to know why visitors were attracted to Robin Hoods Bay. Probably they came here fascinated by the unusual name and wanted to see what the Bay and the village were like. Some came to admire the beautiful scenery. Some came because it is peaceful and quiet here and a change from busy town and cities. Fewer came
